medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Patient was in usual health until 8 hours prior when mild, crampy lower abdominal pain began, associated with nausea, diaphoresis, and chills. At 3 AM, the patient experienced sharp, non-radiating RLQ pain and persistent nausea. Last meal was before the onset of symptoms; passing flatus/BMs per baseline. Denies fever, headache, chest pain, shortness of breath, constipation, diarrhea, or dysuria.
medical_history.past_medical_history: R epididymitis s/p cipro x 10d completed.
medical_history.family_history: Mother: alive and well; Father: alive and well.
